name: Eunbyung Park
content: Eunbyung Park Eunbyung Park Department of Artificial Intelligence School of Computing Yonsei University I am an assistant professor at Yonsei University in South Korea, where I lead the V-Lab. Prior to Yonsei University, I worked at SKKU, Microsoft Project Turing and an autonomous driving startup, Nuro. I completed my PhD at University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill in 2019, advised by Prof Alex Berg. During PhD, I was fortunate to work at Google DeepMind, Microsoft Research, Adobe Research, and HP Labs. I am interested in a broad range of machine learning for visual and scientific computing. Recently, I have worked on neural fields architectures, applications, and training algorithms, and solving partial differential equations with data-driven approaches. Education Ph.D., Computer Science at University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, 2014.09 - 2019.12 M.S., Computer Science at Seoul National University, 2009.03 - 2011.02 B.S., Computer Science at Kyung Hee University, 2002.03 - 2009.02 Work Experience Assistant Professor, Yonsei University, 2025.03 - Present Assistant Professor, SKKU, 2021.02 - 2025.02 Applied Scientist, Microsoft Project Turing, 2020.09 - 2021.02 Research Scientist, Nuro, 2019.06 - 2020.08 Research Intern, Google DeepMind, 2018.06 - 2018.10 Research Intern, Microsoft Research, 2017.06 - 2017.08 Research Intern, Adobe Research, 2016.06 - 2016.08 Research Intern, HP Labs, 2015.06 - 2015.08 News [2025.11] I will serve as an area chair for ICML 2026 [2025.11] LightMarkGS received the best paper award in KIBME 2025! [2025.08] I will serve as an area chair for CVPR 2026 and ICLR 2026 [2025.06] Invited talk at an RSS 2025 Workshop Gaussian Representations for Robot Autonomy: Challenges and Opportunities [2025.04] Invited talk at POSTECH CSE/GSAI Seminar [2025.04] I will serve as an area chair for NeurIPS 2025 [2025.04] Generative Densification was selected as a CVPR 2025 highlight!
